definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: Celine and the girl sang one of her hit song together hand in hand , looking into each other's eyes deeply.
sentences.chinese: 席琳迪翁和女孩手拉手，共同演唱了她的一首成名曲。

sentences.english: That song was his first hit and marked the beginning of his career.
sentences.chinese: 那首歌是他的成名曲，标志着他歌唱职业生涯的开始。

sentences.english: It praises the picturesque landscape of China.
sentences.chinese: 这首名曲赞美了中国的大好河山。

sentences.english: Many people think of this classical music piece when they think" spring" .
sentences.chinese: 许多人在想到“春”的时候都会想到这个经典名曲。

sentences.english: I suppose all the compositions are world famous pieces.
sentences.chinese: 我想所有的曲子都是世界名曲吧。

sentences.english: My uncle Murray was a pianist who could sight-read the most famously complex masterpieces.
sentences.chinese: 我的舅舅默里是一位钢琴家，能视唱最高难度的名曲。

sentences.english: The first large-scale original traditional drum show, Kuan Kung Waving Machetes.
sentences.chinese: 大型首创原创传统鼓乐名曲《关公舞刀》。

definition: to perform on a musical instrument
sung performance/to sing for an audience
